TopicTitle: Boeing 747 with Piggy Back Mk3 Space Shuttle

Articles.Content:
I made a stock Boeing 747 to carry around my Mk3 Space Shuttle! The 747 carries 128 kerbal passengers and 4 crew.

Let's go on a mission to land at the Island Runway.

Craft Files: http://kerbal.curseforge.com/shareables/226920-boeing-747-with-space-shuttle/files

Nice job!

That wing needs some work tho!

Normal 747 has a wing sweep of 37.5 degrees.

Yours has 5-10 degrees of sweep.

Overall, i rate you a 8/10!

Edited January 17, 2015 by RonaldoFTW

Normal 747 has a wing sweep of 27.5 degrees.

It's actually 37.5 degrees I think, small typo?

Nice double decker design. runmug and Jetenginestar are correct though, you need to use the rotate tool and fix up your wings for a proper 747 sweep. Good luck!

You and Naito have inspired me to design and fly my own space shuttle, large cargo bay class, capable of flights being totally empty, or totally full meeting the STS: Orange Tank to Orbit challenge with a full Heavy Payload Plus of an full orange tank and full large yellow rcs tank with hardware.
Sweet! May I please feature this in my upcoming STS recreation youtube series and use the shuttle on top as the Enterprise?
and would it be plausible for me to attach the CSS to this?

Sweet! May I please feature this in my upcoming STS recreation youtube series and use the shuttle on top as the Enterprise?

Go for it! Although the shuttle will destroy the plane if you release it lol.
If you want a releasable version of a shuttle carrier carrying Westi's shuttle, see my I-80 thread for the craft and watch my video.

In case you are interested into the technical aspects of the real thing, here's a video about it.

Notice that the shuttle is mounted at an upward angle and is positioned parallel to the ground on release...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dijD4J3vX5Y

Edited January 13, 2015 by Jetenginestar

This may be a newby question, but whenever I disengage the shuttle from the aircraft I lose all of my stages and the camera stays with the aircraft while the shuttle slowly slides back into the tail. This feels like something stupid but nothing seems to work (controling from ship, Loading kerbals into ship).

anyway, any help is appreciated thanks.

Clark

This may be a newby question, but whenever I disengage the shuttle from the aircraft I lose all of my stages and the camera stays with the aircraft while the shuttle slowly slides back into the tail. This feels like something stupid but nothing seems to work (controling from ship, Loading kerbals into ship).

anyway, any help is appreciated thanks.

Clark

Weird, I honestly never intended the shuttle to be separated while in flight. I built it like the 747 transporter that brought them to their museum 'graves.' In my testing of actually doing the separation, I am able to control the 747 and have flown tailless for a bit lol. Maybe mods or something?
I thought the 7A7 SCA didn't have a tail fin, only side ones? Anyways, awesome plane!And I still can't give you rep...

I thought the 7A7 SCA didn't have a tail fin, only side ones? Anyways, awesome plane!And I still can't give you rep...

It actually has only tail fins and not the side fins but shhh.
To decouple, you must pitch level or down and drop your airspeed. Then select the command module of the shuttle to Control from here to stay piloting the shuttle when it decouples.

Go for it! Although the shuttle will destroy the plane if you release it lol.

Thanks... Since the focus of the series is on the shuttle aspect, I will probably only have TWO kerbals in the shuttle itself and just allow the "loss" of the carrier ship to occur. However, It will be seen again in other rounds of testing. BTW, could you make a small edited version with the space shuttle having a tail cone to go with it?
Just bracket switch to the carrier after the drop to gain control and fly it up and away safely and then switch back to the shuttle. No need to sacrifice Kerbals.

Just bracket switch to the carrier after the drop to gain control and fly it up and away safely and then switch back to the shuttle. No need to sacrifice Kerbals.

Who said anything about sacrificing Kerbals, the only 2 on board would be in the orbiter!

Nice double decker design. runmug and Jetenginestar are correct though, you need to use the rotate tool and fix up your wings for a proper 747 sweep. Good luck!

You and Naito have inspired me to design and fly my own space shuttle, large cargo bay class, capable of flights being totally empty, or totally full meeting the STS: Orange Tank to Orbit challenge with a full Heavy Payload Plus of an full orange tank and full large yellow rcs tank with hardware.

I think you meant me because runmug didn't say anything about wing sweep?
